headline: Georgia legislature passes bill to boost gang prosecutions
sentences: Attorney General Chris Carr, a Republican running for reelection this year, has praised the legislation as a force multiplier? that will allow his office to work with law enforcement and district attorneys.
Sen. John Kennedy, a Republican from Macon, said Monday that local prosecutors have trouble going after gang operations that go beyond their jurisdictions.
Under the bill, a new unit within the attorney generals office would have concurrent authority with local prosecutors to bring gang cases.
A bill that would give Georgias attorney general the authority to prosecute gang crimes statewide is headed to the governors desk.
No ones authority is being infringed upon, but were bringing added resources where theyre needed,? Kennedy said.
The attorney generals office would also pursue gang activity in prisons, he said.
The state Senate passed House Bill 1134 on Monday by a vote of 50 to 5.
The state House approved the measure in February.
The governors budget funds the unit.
Brian Kemp is expected to sign it.
